homepage.title: Developer Hub

categoryDescriptions.smartContracts: On-chain programs for creating and managing digital assets on Solana.
categoryDescriptions.devTools: Tools and utilities to help you build with Metaplex programs.

officialLinks.name: Name

stabilityIndex.immutableDescription: Program is immutable. This allows the program to inherit the full security guarantees of Solana or the SVM.
stabilityIndex.codeFreezeDescription: Functionality and features of program are finalized. Security firms perform final audits before upgrade authority is destroyed.
stabilityIndex.stableDescription: Compatibility with the ecosystem is a high priority.
stabilityIndex.experimentalDescription: The feature may emit warnings. The feature is not subject to Semantic Versioning rules. Non-backward compatible changes or removal may occur in any future release. Use of the feature is not recommended in production or mainnet environments.
stabilityIndex.deprecatedDescription: The feature may emit warnings. Backward compatibility is not guaranteed.

protocolFees.title: Protocol Fees
protocolFees.faqFeesChangeQuestion: Will the fee amounts change over time?
protocolFees.faqFeesChangeAnswer: The Metaplex Foundation is constantly monitoring community feedback related to the fees and may change the fee amounts over time. Our goal is for fees to be minimally disruptive and promote the growth and usage of the protocol.
protocolFees.faqHowUsedQuestion: How are Metaplex Protocol Fees Used?
protocolFees.faqHowUsedAnswer: All protocol fees are used to further the objectives of the Metaplex Foundation, which is a non-profit organization established to foster the research, development and adoption of the Metaplex ecosystem. This includes providing incentives and assistance to the Metaplex community for the continued development, security, governance, and administration of the Metaplex Protocol and Metaplex DAO.
protocolFees.faqHowUsedAnswer2: Currently, 50% of protocol fees are converted to $MPLX and contributed to the Metaplex DAO treasury. The remaining 50% are reserved by the Metaplex Foundation to support the long-term sustainable development of the Metaplex ecosystem.
